caption: This photograph features a wooden sign with white lettering that reads "VANDALISM SPOILS YOUR PARK," mounted on two vertical wooden posts. The sign is positioned in front of a large rock surface that has been extensively vandalized. Various graffiti, including scratched names, initials, and symbols, can be seen covering the rock face. The setting appears to be in a natural park environment, evidenced by the presence of wild grasses and small plants in front of the rock. The overall lighting in the image suggests this photo was taken on a bright day, enhancing the colors and textures of both the reddish-brown rock and the contrasting white lettering of the sign. This scene poignantly contrasts the natural beauty of the surroundings with the destructive human impact of vandalism.
title: Vandalism is a problem, as most of the Canyonlands National Park area is unsupervised.
